translated: Translation: Sutra Translation (Eastern Jin) Records of the Three Treasures through the Ages, Volume 7, Sutra Translation, Eastern Jin
Submitted by the Imperial Secretary, Subject Fei Changfang, in the 17th year of the Kaihuang era
The Eastern Jin records. The great-grandson of Emperor Xuan, a descendant of the Prince of Langya, the son of Prince Gong Jing
Name Rui, courtesy name Jingwen.
At the time of his birth, there was a divine light in the inner quarters, illuminating the entire room.
White hair grew on the left corner of his eyes.
His eyes had a brilliant luster, as if shining with brilliance.
He held the positions of General Who Pacifies the East, Commander-in-Chief of Yangzhou, and Left Premier.
After the fall of Emperor Huai, the officials were scattered.
Some fled to the south of the Yangtze River.
Some were killed by Yao.
Chang'an lost its hold, and the emperor was detained in Pinyang.
At that time, the south of the Yangtze River suddenly saw five hundred people advising Rui to proclaim himself the King of Jin.
To unify the myriad affairs and rule over the billions.
After the death of Emperor Min, he finally ascended the throne.
Proclaimed the first year of Jianwu.
Because of this, the capital was established in Jianye.
To avoid offending Emperor Min, it was renamed Jiankang.
Previously, in the second year of Taikang, the former general of Wu, Guan Gong, caused an uprising.
At that time, Wu Zhen of Jianye divined it with stalks and said:
Guan is already destroyed.
However, after another thirty-eight years,
there will be an emperor in Yangzhou.
By this time, it was indeed as he had said.
Moreover, a physiognomist said during the time of Emperor Shi Huang of Qin:
Five hundred years later, an emperor will emerge from Mount Jinling in Wu.
Emperor Shi Huang feared this.
He dispatched troops to dig up Mount Jinling and renamed it Moling.
He hoped to end its kingship.
From the time of Emperor Yu to Emperor Rui, five hundred and twenty-six years passed.
The Jin dynasty, with its golden rule, unified the four seas.
The auspiciousness of Jinling was present at this time.
There was also a saying:
Five horses floated across the Jiang River,
and one horse transformed into a dragon.
During the chaos of the Yongjia period, the world was in turmoil.
Only the five kings of Langya, Xiyang, Runan, Nandun, and Pengcheng were able to cross the Jiang region.
And the capital was established in Jiankang.
It should be known that receiving the mandate is due to the spiritual response of Heaven, and wanting to establish a state is based on the power of the earth. The earth supports its power.
The First Emperor of Qin dug it but could not destroy it.
Heaven bestows its spirit.
Liu Yao destroyed it but could not completely exterminate it.
From the first year of the Yuanjia era of Emperor Yuan, Dingchou, when the capital was first established,
To the first year of Emperor Gong's Yuanxi era, Jiwei, when the throne was ceded to the Song.
During this period, one hundred and forty years.
Twenty-seven people from China and India, both monks and laypeople.
The sutras they produced, as well as the old lost translations,
Totaled two hundred and sixty-three texts.
In five hundred and eighty-five fascicles.
Compiled as the record of the twelve rulers of the Eastern Jin in Jiankang.
Shi Lishi Mituo of the Eastern Jin
Three texts in eleven fascicles, sutras and spells, Monk Zhi Daogen
Two texts in seven fascicles, sutras, Monk Kang Fa Sui

Means Auspicious Friend in Chinese.
The son of a king.
Should inherit the throne, but gave the country to his younger brother.
Secretly emulated Taibo, awakened his mind, and opened up internally.
Thus became a Å›ramaá¹‡a.
Heavenly features are lofty and bright, the spiritual energy is outstanding.
Simply facing him.
Already stands out.
Beyond the world.
How much more so his intelligence, eloquence, and understanding?
The Chancellor Wang Dao saw him once and marveled at him.
Considered him to be his disciple.
Thus, he became known by this name.
Dao often said to Mi:
In foreign countries, there is only one ruler.
Mi laughed and replied:
If I were like the donor,
how could I have traveled here today?
At that time, people considered this a good response.
He was good at reciting spells and whatever he faced was effective.
He flourished in Jiankang.
People called him the High Seat Dharma Master.
He also taught his disciple Mi Li to chant the Sanskrit verses in a loud voice.
The sound has been passed down to the present day.ğŸ”½Zhi Daogen's Achunduo Fofo Zhizhe Pusa Xuecheng Pin Jing, 2 fascicles, translated in the Taikang era.

Shi Huiyuan bows his head.

Those who possess these will flourish in the Way.
Those who do not have them will be obstructed.
You virtuous ones have them all.
Therefore, I entrust words to convey my goodwill.
I rely on translation to transmit my thoughts.
How could it be able to exhaust?
I merely roughly repay your intention.

But people do not match things.
I am ashamed of it.
Now I always use a brass double-mouthed
washing jug. It can be counted as one of the Dharma implements.
And left behind a verse, saying:
Having already abandoned attachment and pleasure, the mind is well-concentrated.

A single subtle movement in the objective realm forms this momentum of a collapsing mountain.
Or thoughts further ride on each other, touching the principle, naturally giving rise to obstruction.
Although causes and conditions have no master, opening the way is not of one generation.
At that time, there was no guiding master who understood the fundamental principle, who would grasp the profound connection?
The questions that come are still vague, we make an appointment for the end of the year together.

Yuan sighed and said,
The Buddha is the ultimate.

Thus, he wrote the Treatise on the Nature of Dharma, saying,
The ultimate takes non-change as its nature.
The attainment of nature takes the realization of the ultimate as its essence.
KumÄrajÄ«va read the treatise and sighed, saying,

yet his words accord with the principle.
Isn't it wonderful?

Governing a country by serving the ruler.
It is not as good as propagating the Way to save the myriad states.
Serving one's parents to perfect a family.

and the brilliant colors,

is like my admiration for worldly affairs.
